post_text: November 15, 2018 at 6:47 PM#1Hi everyone,Recent Eos to MA2 convert here, looking for help to create a Select Last macro. It's for those times I clear a selection or clear all, but want to re-select the previously cleared fixture/group/channel (but NOT the attributes I had in the programmer). It's like Oops but only for selection. So if I reconsider a color or gobo choice, I don't have to think "oh which group was this?" or have to search for the right fixture, I can just fire this macro and change what I want. And preferably, like Oops, it goes back a little in ways in command history. A little knitpicky I know.If anyone has any insight into this, I'd appreciate it, thanks!-Chris

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 15, 2018 at 7:19 PM#2You would need to have a macro that stores to a dummy group andthenclears. Then you could recall the dummy group. If you wanted to be able to go backwards a few, you'd need to use a few dummy groups and have the macro keep track of which it was storing to.Alternatively, you could keep MA 3D in session on a laptop next to you, logged into the same user as you, with Keep Selection enabled in 3D. Then you could use the <left arrow> button on the left side of the top toolbar to step backwards through your selections.
